meanings.definition: In a dazed or unsteady manner, as from lack of sleep or intoxication.
meanings.sent1: After staying up late, she walked groggily to the kitchen for a glass of water.
meanings.sent2: He woke up groggily, trying to remember where he left his keys.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed groggily after taking a nap in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The old car groggily sputtered to life on a cold morning.
meanings.sent5: The student stumbled groggily into class, still half-asleep.
